document_title: Ventricular extrasystole: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, prevention
subsection_content:
In the mild stage, ventricular extrasystoles often show few or no symptoms. As the disease progresses, it can cause abnormal sensations in the chest, palpitations, feeling of missed beats, tightness in the throat, tightness in the chest, skipped beats, dropped beats; accompanied by dizziness, pain and discomfort in the chest...
If you experience any of the above symptoms, see a cardiologist for advice, examination, and appropriate diagnostic tests.
